gpcm.util module¶

gpcm.util.autocorr(x, lags=None, cov=False, window=False)[source]¶

Estimate the autocorrelation.

Parameters

  • x (vector) – Time series to estimate autocorrelation of.

  • lags (int, optional) – Number of lags. Defaults to all lags.

  • cov (bool, optional) – Compute covariances rather than correlations. Defaults to False.

  • window (bool, optional) – Apply a triangular window to the estimate. Defaults to False.

Returns

Autocorrelation.

Return type

vector

gpcm.util.closest_psd(a, inv=False)[source]¶

Map a matrix to the closest PSD matrix.

Parameters

  • a (tensor) – Matrix.

  • inv (bool, optional) – Also invert a.

Returns

PSD matrix closest to a or the inverse of a.

Return type

tensor

gpcm.util.collect(name='Quantities', **kw_args)[source]¶

Construct a named tuple with certain attributes.

Parameters

  • **kw_args (object) – Keyword argument specifying the attributes.

  • name (str) – Name of the named tuple. Defaults to “Quantities”.

Returns

Named tuple of the model with the

specified attributes.

Return type

collections.namedtuple

gpcm.util.estimate_psd(t, k, n_zero=2000, db=False)[source]¶

Estimate the PSD from samples of the kernel.

Parameters

  • t (vector) – Time points of the kernel, which should be a linear space starting from the origin.

  • k (vector) – Kernel.

  • n_zero (int, optional) – Zero padding. Defaults to 2_000.

  • db (bool, optional) – Convert to decibel. Defaults to False.

Returns

PSD, correctly scaled.

Return type

vector

gpcm.util.hessian(f, x)[source]¶

Compute the Hessian of a function at a certain input.

Parameters

  • f (function) – Function to compute Hessian of.

  • x (column vector) – Input to compute Hessian at.

  • differentiable (bool, optional) – Make the computation of the Hessian differentiable. Defaults to False.

Returns

Hessian.

Return type

matrix

gpcm.util.invert_perm(perm)[source]¶

Compute the inverse of a permutation.

Parameters

perm (list) – Permutation to invert.

gpcm.util.laplace_approximation(f, x_init, f_eval=None)[source]¶

Perform a Laplace approximation of a density.

Parameters

  • f (function) – Possibly unnormalised log-density.

  • x_init (column vector) – Starting point to start the optimisation.

  • f_eval (function) – Use this log-density for the evaluation at the MAP estimate.

Returns

Laplace approximation.

Return type

tuple[stheno.Normal]

gpcm.util.maximum_a_posteriori(f, x_init, iters=2000)[source]¶

Compute the MAP estimate.

Parameters

  • f (function) – Possibly unnormalised log-density.

  • x_init (column vector) – Starting point to start the optimisation.

  • iters (int, optional) – Number of optimisation iterations. Defaults to 2000.

Returns

MAP estimate.

Return type

tensor

gpcm.util.method(cls)[source]¶

Decorator to add the function as a method to a class.

Parameters

cls (type) – Class to add the function as a method to.

gpcm.util.min_phase(h)[source]¶

Minimum phase transform using the Hilbert transform.

Parameters

h (vector) – Filter to transform.

Returns

Minimum phase filter version of h.

Return type

vector

gpcm.util.summarise_samples(x, samples, db=False)[source]¶

Summarise samples.

Parameters

  • x (vector) – Inputs of samples.

  • samples (tensor) – Samples, with the first dimension corresponding to different samples.

  • db (bool, optional) – Convert to decibels.

Returns

Named tuple containing various

statistics of the samples.

Return type

collections.namedtuple
